verses.verse: To the chief Musician, <WH5329> A Psalm <WH4210> of David, <WH1732> when Nathan <WH5416> the prophet <WH5030> came <WH935> unto <WH413> him, after <WH834> he had gone in <WH935> to <WH413> Bathsheba. <WH1339> Have mercy <WH2603> upon me, O God, <WH430> according to thy lovingkindness: <WH2617> according unto the multitude <WH7230> of thy tender mercies <WH7356> blot out <WH4229> my transgressions. <WH6588>
Wash <WH3526> me throughly <WH7235> from mine iniquity, <WH4480> <WH5771> and cleanse <WH2891> me from my sin. <WH4480> <WH2403>
For <WH3588> I <WH589> acknowledge <WH3045> my transgressions: <WH6588> and my sin <WH2403> is ever <WH8548> before <WH5048> me.

Against thee, thee only, <WH905> have I sinned, <WH2398> and done <WH6213> this evil <WH7451> in thy sight: <WH5869> that <WH4616> thou mightest be justified <WH6663> when thou speakest, <WH1696> and be clear <WH2135> when thou judgest. <WH8199>
Behold, <WH2005> I was shapen <WH2342> in iniquity; <WH5771> and in sin <WH2399> did my mother <WH517> conceive <WH3179> me.
Behold, <WH2005> thou desirest <WH2654> truth <WH571> in the inward parts: <WH2910> and in the hidden <WH5640> part thou shalt make me to know <WH3045> wisdom. <WH2451>
Purge <WH2398> me with hyssop, <WH231> and I shall be clean: <WH2891> wash <WH3526> me, and I shall be whiter <WH3835> than snow. <WH4480> <WH7950>
Make me to hear <WH8085> joy <WH8342> and gladness; <WH8057> that the bones <WH6106> which thou hast broken <WH1794> may rejoice. <WH1523>
Hide <WH5641> thy face <WH6440> from my sins, <WH4480> <WH2399> and blot out <WH4229> all <WH3605> mine iniquities. <WH5771>
Create <WH1254> in me a clean <WH2889> heart, <WH3820> O God; <WH430> and renew <WH2318> a right <WH3559> spirit <WH7307> within <WH7130> me.
Cast <WH7993> me not <WH408> away from thy presence; <WH4480> <WH6440> and take <WH3947> not <WH408> thy holy <WH6944> spirit <WH7307> from <WH4480> me.
Restore <WH7725> unto me the joy <WH8342> of thy salvation; <WH3468> and uphold <WH5564> me with thy free <WH5082> spirit. <WH7307>
Then will I teach <WH3925> transgressors <WH6586> thy ways; <WH1870> and sinners <WH2400> shall be converted <WH7725> unto <WH413> thee.
Deliver <WH5337> me from bloodguiltiness, <WH4480> <WH1818> O God, <WH430> thou God <WH430> of my salvation: <WH8668> and my tongue <WH3956> shall sing aloud <WH7442> of thy righteousness. <WH6666>
O Lord, <WH136> open <WH6605> thou my lips; <WH8193> and my mouth <WH6310> shall show forth <WH5046> thy praise. <WH8416>
For <WH3588> thou desirest <WH2654> not <WH3808> sacrifice; <WH2077> else would I give <WH5414> it: thou delightest <WH7521> not <WH3808> in burnt offering. <WH5930>
The sacrifices <WH2077> of God <WH430> are a broken <WH7665> spirit: <WH7307> a broken <WH7665> and a contrite <WH1794> heart, <WH3820> O God, <WH430> thou wilt not <WH3808> despise. <WH959>
Do good <WH3190> in thy good pleasure <WH7522> unto <WH853> Zion: <WH6726> build <WH1129> thou the walls <WH2346> of Jerusalem. <WH3389>

Then <WH227> shalt thou be pleased <WH2654> with the sacrifices <WH2077> of righteousness, <WH6664> with burnt offering <WH5930> and whole burnt offering: <WH3632> then <WH227> shall they offer <WH5927> bullocks <WH6499> upon <WH5921> thine altar. <WH4196>
